ZA Bank is using digital technology to improve operational efficiency. Instilling the core philosophy of the â€?Iâ€?â€?Instant, Interactive and Intelligent, WeLab Bank is using artificial intelligence, big data and machine learning and other leading technologies to design and build products and services to bring a new digital experience for the Hong Kong public.

Ant Bank continue to promote the development and application of digital technology, introducing leading products like AntChain, OceanBase, SOFAStack, and mPaaS based on our expertise in blockchain, privacy computing, security technology, and distributed database. We are committed to working with partners across different industries to support the small and medium-sized financial institutions in their digital transformation, enable SMEs in the service industry to operate digitally and facilitate digital collaboration across industries.

Livi makes use of artificial intelligence (AI) and e-Know Your Customer in order to help SMEs apply for a bank account and secure loans without having to visit a physical bank branch.

Mox is fully cloud native, with a cloud-based core banking system that can scale development, test environments and loads, ensuring stability with steady costs. Alongside, it has implemented storage solutions for resilient services, automation and process optimisation to improve efficiency in the end-to-end customer journey. Walker shared that the average customer onboarding time is approximately five minutes, with over 70% of applications being processed straight through, including all necessary checks and verifications.
 Given the increasing number of customers, the bank has wider access to customers data including their transactions and behavior that it plans to leverage. It uses artificial intelligence and machine learning across various areas, such as cybersecurity, behavioural analytics, and credit risk to enhance business decisions.

PAOB is pioneering data sharing and partnerships. Real-time data plays a key role in transforming small- and medium-size business (SMB) lending experiences. By continuously innovating, Klarna makes online shopping more accessible and efficient for millions.

Revolut, a prominent UK fintech, revolutionizes banking through its mobile app, offering a suite of services including currency exchange, cryptocurrency trading, and peer-to-peer payments. By leveraging APIs and in-house technology, Revolut ensures a seamless user experience and low transaction fees. The platform utilizes data analytics to provide real-time insights, enhancing customer engagement and operational efficiency. With a focus on innovation, Revolut continuously expands its offerings, making financial services more accessible and user-friendly for millions globally.

Tinkoff, a leading digital bank in Russia, leverages AI and machine learning to enhance customer service and operational efficiency. Their AI voice assistant handles approximately 40% of customer inquiries in chat and resolves issues in the call center within an average of 40 seconds, significantly reducing the need for human intervention. The platform employs advanced technology to ensure fast, secure transactions, and offers features like the Wise Account, which enables users to hold multiple currencies and manage their finances seamlessly. With a commitment to innovation, Wise continues to enhance its services, making global finance more accessible and efficient for millions of users worldwide.

Afterpay, a leading Australian fintech, specializes in Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) services, allowing consumers to make purchases and pay in four interest-free installments. This model enhances accessibility to goods while promoting responsible spending. The platform utilizes advanced technology to facilitate seamless transactions across various retail channels, both online and in-store. Afterpayâ€™s integration with merchants boosts sales by increasing average order values, while its robust data analytics capabilities help optimize user experience and risk management. The platform supports over 80 cryptocurrencies and provides users with tools to earn interest on their holdings, enhancing financial flexibility. With a focus on innovation and user empowerment, Crypto.com is reshaping the landscape of digital finance.

AirWallex, an Australian fintech company, provides a comprehensive financial platform designed for global businesses. By leveraging advanced payment technology, AirWallex facilitates cross-border transactions with minimal fees and real-time currency conversion, making international payments seamless and efficient.
 
 The platform integrates API solutions that allow businesses to manage payments, treasury, and expenses all in one place. With a focus on innovation, AirWallex empowers companies to scale globally without the traditional barriers of the financial system, enhancing operational efficiency and financial flexibility.

Tyro, an Australian fintech, specializes in providing innovative payment solutions and business banking products tailored for local merchants. Utilizing cutting-edge technology, Tyro offers seamless EFTPOS services, enabling businesses to accept payments efficiently and securely.

Tala, a prominent fintech based in Kenya, is dedicated to providing accessible financial services to underserved populations. Utilizing advanced AI and machine learning, Tala offers instant access to credit, enabling users to manage their finances effectively through a mobile-first platform.
 
 The app bridges digital and cash ecosystems, allowing customers to perform transactions, pay bills, and send remittances seamlessly. TymeBank offers low-cost transactional accounts and savings products, focusing on financial inclusion and affordability. Its innovative approach has enabled rapid customer growth, reaching millions since its launch in 2019.

Niyo, an innovative fintech based in India, offers a range of digital banking solutions designed to enhance the financial experience for salaried individuals. Jenius, a pioneering digital banking platform in Indonesia, aims to simplify banking for younger customers by addressing the pain points of traditional banking. Utilizing cloud-based technology, Jenius offers a seamless mobile banking experience that includes features like real-time transaction notifications, budgeting tools, and customizable savings accounts.
 
 The platform emphasizes user empowerment through its user-friendly app, which allows customers to manage their finances easily and access various banking services without the need for physical branches. KakaoBank, South Koreaâ€™s first fully digital bank, leverages advanced technology to provide a seamless banking experience. Toss, a leading fintech in South Korea, has transformed from a simple money transfer app into a comprehensive financial platform. Utilizing advanced technology, Toss offers a wide range of services, including peer-to-peer payments, bill payments, and investment options, all accessible through its user-friendly mobile app.
 
 The platform emphasizes user convenience with features like instant account setup using just a phone number and high-level security through biometric authentication. Toss aims to become a super app that meets all financial needs, continually innovating to enhance user experience and expand its offerings. With over 20 million downloads, Toss is a key player in the digital finance landscape, driving financial inclusion and efficiency in South Korea.

Judo Bank, an Australian neobank focused on small and medium enterprises (SMEs), leverages cloud-based technology to deliver efficient banking solutions. Macquarie Bank, a leading financial services provider in Australia, is at the forefront of digital transformation in banking.  The bank has implemented a cloud-based general ledger and consolidated its data environment, which has halved operating costs and streamlined data management. Additionally, Macquarie collaborates with Google Cloud to develop AI-driven banking solutions, enabling personalized customer experiences through advanced data analytics and machine learning. This commitment to innovation positions Macquarie as a competitive player in the evolving financial landscape.

Open, an innovative fintech in India, focuses on providing digital banking solutions tailored for small businesses and startups. Utilizing cloud technology, Open offers a seamless banking experience that includes features like automated bookkeeping, expense management, and real-time transaction tracking.
 
 The platform integrates with various accounting tools, enabling users to manage their finances efficiently without the hassle of traditional banking. By leveraging data analytics, Open empowers businesses with insights to make informed financial decisions, enhancing operational efficiency and promoting financial literacy among entrepreneurs.

Openpay, an Australian fintech company, specializes in Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) services, allowing customers to make purchases and pay in interest-free installments. Utilizing advanced payment technology, Openpay provides a seamless online and in-store payment experience, enhancing consumer accessibility to goods and services.
 
 The platform integrates with various retailers across multiple sectors, including retail, healthcare, and automotive, enabling flexible payment options for customers. Openpayâ€™s focus on data analytics helps optimize transaction processes and improve customer engagement, making it a competitive player in the evolving financial landscape of Australia.

BigPay, a Malaysian fintech, offers a comprehensive digital banking solution designed to empower users with financial management tools. Utilizing cloud-based technology, BigPay provides a mobile app that allows users to spend, send, receive, and track their money effortlessly.
 
 The platform features a prepaid card linked to the app, enabling users to make transactions globally without markup fees on foreign spending. BigPay also emphasizes transparency with no hidden charges, making it a user-friendly alternative to traditional banking. With plans to expand its services across Southeast Asia, BigPay is positioned as a key player in the regionâ€™s digital finance landscape.

Volt Bank, an Australian neobank, is dedicated to providing innovative banking solutions through a fully digital platform. Utilizing cloud technology, Volt offers a seamless banking experience with features like instant account opening, real-time transaction notifications, and personalized financial insights.
 
 The bank emphasizes open banking principles, allowing customers to connect their accounts with various financial services for enhanced management of their finances. Voltâ€™s commitment to security and user experience is evident in its use of advanced encryption and biometric authentication, ensuring that customer data is protected while providing a user-friendly interface. With a focus on transparency and customer empowerment, Volt Bank is reshaping the future of banking in Australia.

Paidy, a leading fintech in Japan, provides a unique payment solution that allows consumers to shop online without needing a credit card or pre-registration. Utilizing proprietary technology, Paidy enables users to make purchases and pay for them later through a consolidated monthly bill.
 
 The platform is optimized for mobile and instant checkout, enhancing the shopping experience for users who prefer not to use traditional credit methods. By employing advanced algorithms to assess creditworthiness and underwrite transactions, Paidy helps merchants increase conversion rates and average order values. With its focus on convenience and security, Paidy is reshaping the landscape of online payments in Japan.

Hay, an Australian fintech, is revolutionizing the way individuals manage their finances through a user-friendly mobile app. By leveraging advanced technology, Hay offers features like automated budgeting, real-time spending insights, and seamless integration with various financial accounts, empowering users to take control of their financial health.
 
 The platform emphasizes simplicity and accessibility, allowing users to track their expenses effortlessly and set savings goals. With a focus on enhancing financial literacy, Hay aims to provide tools that help users make informed decisions, ultimately fostering a more financially savvy community in Australia.

FairMoney, a Nigerian fintech, is transforming the financial landscape by providing accessible banking services to underserved populations. Initially launched as a lending platform, FairMoney has evolved into a credit-led digital bank, offering collateral-free personal loans and a range of financial services through its mobile app.
 
 Utilizing advanced algorithms for credit assessment, FairMoney enables quick loan approvals and disbursements, catering to the needs of millions. The platform also plans to expand its offerings to include features like savings accounts, peer-to-peer transfers, and debit cards, aiming to provide a comprehensive banking experience for its users. With a focus on financial inclusion, FairMoney is committed to rebuilding Africaâ€™s financial narrative and empowering its customers.

Cashbac, a fintech platform in Indonesia, is designed to reward consumers with instant cashback for their transactions. Utilizing advanced mobile technology, Cashbac offers a user-friendly app that simplifies the process of earning rewards without the complexities of traditional loyalty programs.
 
 The platform partners with over 1,000 merchants, allowing users to receive cashback immediately upon making purchases. By eliminating the need for top-ups and expiry dates on rewards, Cashbac enhances the shopping experience and encourages consumer engagement. With a focus on financial inclusivity, Cashbac aims to empower users to maximize their rewards effortlessly.

Pi Pay, a leading fintech in Cambodia, offers a versatile mobile payment platform that simplifies transactions for users and merchants alike. Utilizing advanced mobile technology, Pi Pay enables users to make payments, transfer money, and pay bills seamlessly through its user-friendly app.
 
 The platform emphasizes security and convenience, employing encryption and biometric authentication to protect user data. Pi Pay also partners with various merchants, allowing users to earn rewards and cashback on their transactions, enhancing customer engagement. With a focus on financial inclusion, Pi Pay aims to make digital payments accessible to a broader audience in Cambodia.

Sharesies, a prominent fintech in New Zealand, democratizes investing by allowing users to start with as little as 1 cent. Utilizing cloud-based technology, Sharesies offers a user-friendly platform that provides access to a wide range of investment options, including shares, ETFs, and managed funds across New Zealand, Australia, and the U.S..
 
 The platform emphasizes simplicity and transparency, with a 1.9% transaction fee capped at a maximum amount depending on the market. Sharesies also incorporates features like auto-investing, enabling users to invest regularly without hassle. With over 600,000 investors, Sharesies is committed to making investing accessible and engaging for everyone.

86 400, an Australian neobank, was designed to provide a fully digital banking experience tailored for mobile users. Utilizing cloud-based technology, it offers features such as instant account setup, real-time transaction notifications, and budgeting tools, making banking accessible and user-friendly.
 
 In early 2021, 86 400 was acquired by National Australia Bank (NAB), which integrated its innovative technology and visual identity into ubank. This acquisition aimed to enhance customer experience and streamline banking services, leveraging 86 400â€™s capabilities to create a more competitive digital banking platform in Australia. With a focus on simplicity and efficiency, 86 400 continues to influence the evolution of digital banking under the ubank brand.

Flip is a leading Indonesian fintech that simplifies money transfers through its user-friendly app. By offering free interbank transfers, Flip addresses common pain points in peer-to-peer transactions, such as high fees and lengthy processing times. The platform utilizes data analytics to enhance user experience and operational efficiency, allowing users to manage their finances seamlessly.
 
 Flip also employs machine learning to streamline transaction processes and improve security, minimizing manual interventions. With features like real-time transfers and multi-recipient payments, Flip continuously innovates to meet the evolving needs of its users, making financial services more accessible for millions in Indonesia.

YouTrip is a multi-currency mobile wallet designed to simplify travel payments for users. Launched in 2018, it allows users to make transactions in over 150 currencies without incurring hidden fees. The app provides real-time exchange rates and enables users to convert currencies at wholesale rates, ensuring they get the best value for their money.
 
 The platform is powered by bank-grade security measures, ensuring safe transactions and user data protection. YouTrip also offers a physical card that can be used globally wherever Mastercard is accepted, making it a versatile option for travelers. By continuously innovating and enhancing user experience, YouTrip aims to make managing travel expenses seamless and efficient.

Chipper Cash is a leading fintech platform in Africa that facilitates free and instant peer-to-peer money transfers across multiple countries, including Kenya, Uganda, and Nigeria. By leveraging a user-friendly mobile app, Chipper Cash allows users to send money, pay bills, and even invest in stocks with minimal fees, making financial transactions accessible and efficient.
 
 The platform utilizes bank-grade security to protect user data and transactions, ensuring a safe experience. Chipper Cash also integrates with various mobile money services, enabling seamless cross-border payments and enhancing financial inclusion across the continent. With over 5 million users, Chipper Cash is committed to simplifying money management for individuals and businesses alike.

InstantPay is a comprehensive digital banking platform designed for businesses in India, offering a range of financial services through a unified dashboard. The platform facilitates instant payments, collections, and expense management, making it easier for businesses to manage their finances efficiently.
 
 By leveraging secure APIs, InstantPay automates workflows and integrates seamlessly with existing banking systems, enhancing operational efficiency. The platform also provides features like utility bill payments, cash withdrawals, and mobile recharges, catering to diverse financial needs. With a focus on security, InstantPay employs advanced measures to protect user data and transactions, ensuring a safe banking experience.

Neat is a fintech platform that simplifies financial services for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) and startups in Hong Kong. It enables businesses to quickly incorporate and open accounts online, allowing them to receive and transfer multi-currency funds efficiently. The application process is fully digital, taking as little as 15 minutes to complete, eliminating the need for paperwork and lengthy waiting times.
 
 Neat offers features such as virtual and physical Visa cards, integration with accounting tools like Xero, and seamless payment processing capabilities. By leveraging advanced technology, Neat provides a secure and user-friendly experience, empowering businesses to manage their finances and engage in international trade with ease.

Kuda is a digital-only bank that aims to revolutionize banking in Nigeria by offering zero-fee banking services. Founded in 2019, Kuda allows users to make free transfers and manage their finances through a user-friendly mobile app. With features like automated savings, users can set aside a percentage of their spending effortlessly.
 
 The platform employs bank-grade security to ensure safe transactions and protect user data. Kuda also integrates with various financial tools, enabling users to track their spending and manage budgets effectively. With over two million customers, Kuda is committed to enhancing financial inclusion and providing accessible banking solutions for all Nigerians.

Xinja was an innovative neobank in Australia that aimed to disrupt traditional banking by offering a fully digital banking experience. Launched in 2017, Xinja provided zero-fee banking services and a user-friendly mobile app that allowed customers to manage their finances effortlessly. One of its standout products was the Stash savings account, which initially offered competitive interest rates to attract customers.
 
 The platform utilized advanced technology to ensure secure transactions and a seamless user experience. However, despite early success and significant funding, Xinja faced challenges in achieving a sustainable business model. In December 2020, the company announced its exit from the banking sector, returning its banking license and customer deposits, largely due to the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic and difficulties in raising capital.

Niyogin is a pioneering fintech platform focused on providing comprehensive financial services to Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) in India. The company operates a partnership-led business model, leveraging technology to streamline processes such as client onboarding, underwriting, and loan disbursement.
 
 Niyogin offers a range of services, including unsecured loans and digital banking solutions, through an open API and SDK integration, making it easier for partners to deliver financial services. The platform aims to enhance financial inclusion by connecting rural retailers and MSMEs with essential banking services, thereby empowering local economies.
 
 With a focus on innovation and customer-centricity, Niyogin is building a robust neobank infrastructure that supports over 250,000 retail stores and numerous financial professionals, facilitating a more inclusive financial ecosystem in India.

Up is Australiaâ€™s first mobile-only digital bank, designed to provide a seamless banking experience for its users. The platform allows users to set savings goals and track their progress effortlessly.
 
 Utilizing a user-friendly mobile app, Up offers features such as 2Up, which facilitates joint accounts for couples, and Maybuy, a savings-based alternative to traditional buy-now-pay-later services. The bank emphasizes transparency and customer engagement, with initiatives like Perk-Up, which rewards users with free coffees, fostering a sense of community among its customers.
 
 With over 750,000 users, Up is committed to delivering a unique banking experience that prioritizes financial wellbeing and innovation, making banking enjoyable and accessible for all Australians.

 By leveraging a cloud-native core banking platform from Mambu, Timo ensures scalability and flexibility in its services. The bank focuses on customer-centric solutions, partnering with popular retail brands to create kiosks for easy account sign-ups. With a commitment to financial inclusion, Timo aims to serve the young, digitally-savvy population of Vietnam, facilitating over two million transactions monthly.

Kyash is a leading mobile financial app in Japan that aims to simplify payments and enhance financial accessibility. Founded in 2015, Kyash offers a range of services, including online and offline payments, remittances, and ATM withdrawals through its user-friendly app. The platform provides both virtual and physical prepaid Visa cards, allowing users to manage their finances flexibly.
 
 Kyash emphasizes a mobile-first approach, leveraging advanced technology to ensure secure transactions and a seamless user experience. With a focus on innovation, Kyash continues to expand its offerings, aiming to become a key player in the evolving landscape of digital banking in Japan.

Beem It is backed by major Australian banks, including Commonwealth Bank, NAB, and Westpac, which enhances its credibility and security. WeLend is a leading online lending platform in Hong Kong, established in 2013. It aims to revolutionize traditional lending services by leveraging artificial intelligence (AI) and big data analytics to streamline the loan application process. The platform offers a fully digital experience, allowing users to apply for personal loans quickly and efficiently, often receiving approval in just minutes.
 
 WeLend emphasizes a customer-centric approach, providing tailored loan solutions that cater to individual financial needs. The platform employs advanced risk assessment algorithms to ensure fair and transparent lending practices. Additionally, WeLend prioritizes cybersecurity, implementing robust measures to protect user data and maintain privacy.
 
 With a commitment to innovation, WeLend continues to enhance its services, including the introduction of features like WeScore, a financial health evaluation tool that helps users understand their creditworthiness and manage their finances better.

The platform offers various services, including savings accounts, foreign currency accounts, and investment products, all accessible through a user-friendly mobile app.

The bank is also exploring innovative financial products, such as digital securities backed by entertainment assets, aiming to merge finance with digital content. This initiative reflects Sony Bankâ€™s commitment to integrating technology and creativity, providing customers with unique investment opportunities.

Statrys is leveraging digital technology to enhance financial services for SMEs in Hong Kong. The platform offers multi-currency business accounts, enabling seamless transactions in 14 currencies. Utilizing a cloud-native infrastructure, Statrys ensures secure operations with real-time transaction tracking and competitive exchange rates. The platform integrates with accounting software and provides SWIFT payment tracking, streamlining financial management for businesses.

Walrus is a neobank in India designed for the youth, providing instant access to funds without the need for a traditional bank account. Launched in 2019, it offers users a UPI ID and debit card, making financial management easy and engaging. The platform focuses on financial literacy, aiming to help young Indians learn about money management through a user-friendly app. By leveraging technology, Walrus creates a community-driven experience that resonates with the Instagram generation.

Bettr is a digital banking app in South Africa designed to empower the youth with accessible financial services. Launched by a team of creative entrepreneurs, Bettr offers features like virtual cards and instant payments, focusing on a user-friendly experience. The platform aims to foster financial literacy and community engagement, catering specifically to the needs of Gen Z and millennials. By leveraging technology, Bettr seeks to create a new culture of money management that resonates with younger consumers.

Jibun Bank is a digital-only bank in Japan that focuses on providing high-quality financial services via smartphones. Established in 2008, it offers features like cashless transactions, AI-driven market forecasting, and foreign currency savings. The platform emphasizes user experience with services such as smart ATMs that allow cash deposits and withdrawals without a physical card. By leveraging advanced technology, Jibun Bank aims to enhance financial literacy and rebuild consumer confidence in investments.

MyBank is a leading digital bank in China, established in 2015, that focuses on providing financial services to small and micro-sized enterprises (SMEs). The platform leverages advanced technologies such as AI and machine learning to enhance customer engagement and provide personalized financial insights. With a focus on security and user experience, digibank aims to redefine how customers manage their finances in the digital age.

LINE Pay is a leading mobile payment service in Taiwan, launched in 2015, that allows users to make cashless transactions easily through the LINE app. With over 12 million users and acceptance at more than 540,000 locations, it has become integral to daily transactions in Taiwan. The platform offers features like co-branded credit cards and LINE POINTS rewards, enhancing user engagement and loyalty. By leveraging advanced technology, LINE Pay aims to promote a cashless society and streamline payment processes for consumers and merchants alike.

Naver Pay is a leading mobile payment service in South Korea, integrated within the popular Naver app. Launched in 2015, it allows users to make seamless transactions across various platforms, including Naver Shopping. Naver Pay leverages advanced technologies like AI to enhance user experience and offers features such as QR code payments and loyalty rewards. The platform is expanding its services across Asia, aiming to become a comprehensive financial solution that includes personalized financial products and alternative credit scoring.

TMRW is a mobile-only digital bank by UOB in Thailand, designed to empower the digital generation with innovative banking solutions. Launched to provide a seamless banking experience, TMRW offers features like instant account opening, customizable cashback credit cards, and interactive savings tools. The platform leverages advanced technology to enhance user engagement and financial literacy, making banking accessible and enjoyable for young consumers.

PiggyVest is a leading digital savings platform in Nigeria, launched in 2016, that empowers users to save and invest their money easily. The platform offers features like automated savings, flexible withdrawal options, and investment opportunities, catering primarily to young Nigerians. By leveraging technology, PiggyVest provides a user-friendly experience that encourages financial literacy and responsible money management. With nearly 5 million registered users, it has become a trusted choice for those looking to grow their savings in a secure environment.

CredPal is a fintech company in Nigeria that offers a Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) service, allowing consumers to make purchases and pay in installments. Developed by the Japan Bank Consortium and powered by Ripple, the app allows users to send money using phone numbers or bank account details, facilitating 24/7 transactions. MoneyTap aims to enhance the efficiency of domestic payments, reducing costs associated with traditional banking methods and promoting a cashless society.

Jungle is a fintech platform based in Indonesia, launched in 2020, that focuses on providing financial solutions for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). The platform offers a range of services, including digital lending, cash flow management, and financial analytics, aimed at helping businesses optimize their operations and access necessary funding. By leveraging advanced technology, Jungle enhances financial inclusion for SMEs, enabling them to thrive in a competitive market. The user-friendly interface and data-driven insights empower business owners to make informed financial decisions.

Umba is a digital banking platform operating in Nigeria, launched to provide accessible financial services to underserved markets. The platform offers a range of features, including digital banking accounts, consumer lending, and payroll management solutions.
